fields.summary: mapred classpath CLI does not display the complete classpath

comments.body: Similar to HADOOP-7779
I posted a comment on HADOOP-7779. If its resolved as a "Won't Fix", this should just target the duplication of HADOOP_CONF_DIR and then be resolved.

HADOOP-10903 added support for this in the {{hadoop classpath}} command, but we didn't do the same for the other scripts' classpath commands.  We can repurpose this issue to cover that change for the {{mapred}} script.  Thanks to [~aw] for pointing it out to me.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12691553/MAPREDUCE-3283.001.patch
  against trunk revision ef3c3a8.

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:red}-1 tests included{color}.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  There were no new javadoc warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in .

Kindly review

Hello [~varun_saxena].  For the trunk patch, you'll need to add a call to {{exit /b}} in mapred.cmd so that it doesn't attempt to start a JVM when running {{mapred classpath}} with no additional arguments.  Would you also provide a patch for branch-2?  Thank you.

Thanks for the review [~cnauroth]. Updated a patch for both trunk and branch-2

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12693166/MAPREDUCE-3283-branch-2.patch
  against trunk revision 4a44508.

    {color:red}-1 patch{color}.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/5109//console

This message is automatically generated.

I retested the mapred.cmd change, but unfortunately it still doesn't have the right behavior.  Calling {{exit /b}} from within the {{classpath}} subroutine exits just the subroutine, not the whole script, so it still ends up trying to launch a JVM.  I think we'll need to restructure this so it's more like yarn.cmd, where the classpath command is handled as a special case outside of the other command handling.  That way, the {{exit /b}} would exit from the top-level mapred.cmd script.
Oh. Thought {{exit /b}} was like an overall system exit. Did not have access to a WINDOWS OS at that time so could not test. Will upload a new patch after testing.
